locale.description: A language code. This should be an ISO 639-1 Standard for language codes.

phone.description: The customer’s phone number. This must be E.164 Standard for international telephone number

line1.description: The address line 1 (e.g., street number, street name). This field needs to pass the canonical form of the address

line2.description: The address line 2. This can be additional address data (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

line3.description: The address line 3. This can be more additional address data if needed.

postcode.description: The address ZIP or postal code.

country.description: The address country code. This must be an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 Standard (two-letters) for country codes.

value.description:
The value of the amount.
- An integer for currencies that are not typically fractional
- A decimal fraction for currencies that are subdivided into thousandths

currency.description: The currency code of the amount. This must be an ISO 4217 Standard (three letters) for currency codes.

items.title: PurchaseItem
items.description: A customer's order item to purchase.

quantity.description: The quantity to purchase for the item.

value.description:
The value of the amount.
- An integer for currencies that are not typically fractional
- A decimal fraction for currencies that are subdivided into thousandths

currency.description: The currency code of the amount. This must be an ISO 4217 Standard (three letters) for currency codes.

reference.description: A unique string to reference the payment. This can be an order ID, or similar, and can be used to reconcile the payment with your internal systems.

note.description: Note to attach to the payment. This can be additional information.

cancelUrl.description: The URL to redirect your customers to when the payment is canceled.

successUrl.description: The URL to redirect your customers to when the payment is executed.

source.description:
The payment method.
- HOL: HOLO
- HRM: Huri Money
- MVL: MVola
- PYP: PayPal
- STR: Stripe

next.description: The URL of the immediate next step.

info.title: Nafassi API
info.description: The Nafassi REST API provides resource-oriented endpoints to create and capture payments using HTTP standards (status code, authentication, etc.)

Bearer.description: HTTP Bearer authentication with JWT token

URL.name: token
URL.description: API Key authentication with URL token
